summary: Email correspondence between attorneys discussing compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with a prior non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida. The email confirms a telephone conference and addresses a notice of non-compliance.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Author of the email confirming a telephone conference about Epstein's plea agreement compliance with the non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Recipient of the notice of non-compliance email, involved in discussions regarding Epstein's plea agreement.

persons.name: Ms Villafana
persons.context: Addressed in the email from Jack Goldberger regarding confirmation of the telephone conference about Epstein's plea agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the plea agreement and non-prosecution agreement discussed in the correspondence.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in correspondence regarding Epstein's plea agreement compliance.
Goldberger is discussing Epstein's plea agreement compliance, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Black is included in correspondence about Epstein's plea agreement, suggesting legal representation.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Epstein Plea Agreement
events.description: Telephone conference discussed between Jack Goldberger and Ms Villafana regarding compliance of Epstein's state plea agreement with the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement with USAO
events.description: Non-prosecution agreement entered into between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

keyFacts: A telephone conference occurred on June 27, 2008, to discuss Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement compliance with a prior non-prosecution agreement.
The non-prosecution agreement between Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida was dated September 2007.
Attorneys Jack Goldberger and Roy Black were involved in correspondence regarding a notice of non-compliance related to Epstein's plea agreement.
The email confirms agreement that Epstein's state plea agreement was in compliance with the September 2007 non-prosecution agreement.
